segments.en: Today we're bringing you part two of another great lesson that we had.
segments.cn: 今天我们带来另一堂精彩课程的第二部分。

segments.en: Yeah, and this one is also a little bit strange, a little bit weird.
segments.cn: 是的，这个故事也有点奇怪，有点怪异。
是的，结果不寻常，结局不寻常。

segments.en: But it has to do a lot with invitations.
segments.cn: 但这与邀请有很大关系。

segments.en: So an invitation is when you ask somebody to do something with you.
segments.cn: 邀请是你邀请某人和你一起做某事。

segments.en: So we're going to be talking about invitations and inviting people to do things.
segments.cn: 所以我们将讨论邀请和邀请人们做事情。

segments.en: Well, with that, let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 那么，让我们第一次听对话。

segments.en: Oh, Armand, thank you for such a thoughtful invitation.
segments.cn: 哦，Armand，谢谢你如此体贴的邀请。

segments.en: It's really very nice of you to invite us over for dinner.
segments.cn: 你邀请我们来吃晚餐真是太好了。

segments.en: I don't want to go over to his place for dinner.
Why on earth did you accept?
It'll be nice to get to know him.
Besides, he's new to the neighborhood, and it would be rude to decline his invitation.
segments.cn: 而且，他是新来的，拒绝他的邀请会很无礼。

segments.en: You always wrote me into things like this.
segments.cn: 你总是让我参与这种事情。
女士们，谢谢你们的到来。

segments.en: Oh, Armand, you are too kind.
How did I get myself into this?
segments.cn: 我怎么会陷入这种境地？

segments.en: Wow, I'm really anxious to see what happens in this dinner party.
segments.cn: 哇，我真的很想看看这个晚宴会发生什么。

segments.en: Yeah, I guess we'll have to stay tuned and find out.
segments.cn: 是的，我想我们得继续关注，看看。

segments.en: Alright, well, we have some really great vocabularies, so I guess we can start with language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们有一些很棒的词汇，所以我想我们可以开始语言收获。

segments.en: Alright, on language takeaway today we have three great words.
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的语言收获我们有三个很棒的单词。

segments.en: Erica, why don't you start us off with the first one.
So when you're thoughtful, you're kind, right?
segments.cn: 所以当你体贴时，你是善良的，对吧？

segments.en: You think about what the other person would like.
Our second phrase, give me the creeps.
segments.cn: 我们的第二个短语，给我毛骨悚然。

segments.en: This is kind of a funny phrase, but I think if we listen to some examples, we'll understand the meaning.
segments.cn: 这是一个有点搞笑的短语，但我认为如果我们听一些例子，我们会理解其含义。

segments.en: Horror movies give me the creeps.
segments.cn: 恐怖电影让我毛骨悚然。

segments.en: I saw this really scary clown.
segments.cn: 我看到一个非常可怕的小丑。

segments.en: So I can see this one means to make me feel uncomfortable.
segments.cn: 所以我可以看到这个意思是让我感到不舒服。

segments.en: It makes me feel like scared.
And our last phrase for language takeaway.
segments.cn: 我们的最后一个短语是语言收获。

segments.en: So if you rope me into something, it's... It's like you convince me to do something that I don't really want to do.
segments.cn: 所以如果你牵扯我进某事，那就是... 就像你说服我做我并不想做的事情。

segments.en: So I roped you into lending me your car.
And you roped me into going out for beers after work.
segments.cn: 你让我去下班后喝啤酒。

segments.en: Yeah, that was a great idea.
So I guess we could listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 我想我们可以再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: This time a little bit slower and you'll be able to understand the language a little bit more clearly.
segments.cn: 这次慢一点，你会更清楚地理解语言。

segments.en: Oh, Armand, thank you for such a thoughtful invitation.
segments.cn: 哦，阿尔芒，谢谢你如此周到的邀请。

segments.en: It's really very nice of you to invite us over for dinner.
segments.cn: 你邀请我们来吃晚餐真是太好了。

segments.en: I don't want to go over to his place for dinner.
Why on earth did you accept?
It will be nice to get to know him.
Besides, he's new to the neighborhood, and it will be rude to decline his invitation.
segments.cn: 而且，他是新搬来的，拒绝他的邀请会很失礼。

segments.en: You always wrote me into things like this.
segments.cn: 你总是让我参与这种事情。
女士们，谢谢你们的到来。

segments.en: Oh, Armand, you are too kind.
How did I get myself into this?
segments.cn: 我怎么会陷入这种境地？

segments.en: Well, I guess that's a lot more clear.
And with that, we can start putting it together today.
segments.cn: 有了这个，我们今天可以开始整理了。

segments.en: Today we've got three words and phrases that we want to show you how you can put together and use differently.
segments.cn: 今天我们有三个单词和短语，想给你们展示如何组合和不同使用。

segments.en: The first one is appetite, appetite, appetite, appetite.
segments.cn: 第一个是胃口，胃口，胃口，胃口。

segments.en: So appetite is like a strong desire for food, right?
segments.cn: 所以胃口就像是对食物的强烈渴望，对吧？

segments.en: We've got some examples that show you how to use this phrase.
segments.cn: 我们有一些例子来展示如何使用这个短语。

segments.en: You must have a big appetite.
I have a fever and I have lost my appetite.
Okay, so we saw some great examples of appetite.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们看到了胃口的一些很好的例子。

segments.en: So it just means a desire for food, a hunger for food.
segments.cn: 所以这只是意味着对食物的渴望，饥饿。

segments.en: What's our second phrase for today?
segments.cn: 我们今天的第二个短语是什么？

segments.en: So when you get to know someone is you talk to them and you find out what they do.
segments.cn: 所以当你认识某人时，就是你和他们交谈，了解他们在做什么。

segments.en: Yeah, you get more familiar with them.
For example, we can say I got to know her in Spanish class and she's a really nice person.
segments.cn: 例如，我们可以说我在西班牙语课上认识了她，她是个很好的人。

segments.en: Or you can say Armand, Ellen and Doris got to know each other at a dinner party.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说阿尔芒、艾伦和多丽丝在晚会上互相认识。

segments.en: Or you can say if you get to know me, you'll see that I'm not a bad guy.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说如果你了解我，你会发现我不是个坏人。

segments.en: And our third phrase is why on earth?
segments.cn: 我们的第三个短语是“为什么会这样？”

segments.en: This is like a saying expression.
You can use it in a lot of different ways.
segments.cn: 你可以用很多不同的方式。

segments.en: So we've got some examples for you.
segments.cn: 所以我们有一些例子给你。

segments.en: Where on earth is my phone?
How on earth did you learn English in one month?
segments.cn: 你怎么可能在一个月内学会英语？

segments.en: So when you ask a question with on earth, so why on earth?
segments.cn: 所以当你用“到底”问问题时，比如“为什么会这样？”

segments.en: It's like you're showing a lot of surprise.
segments.cn: 就像你表现出很多惊讶。

segments.en: So let's just listen to our dialogue a third time.
segments.cn: 所以我们再听一遍我们的对话。

segments.en: Oh, Armand, thank you for such a thoughtful invitation.
segments.cn: 哦，阿尔芒，谢谢你如此周到的邀请。

segments.en: It's really very nice of you to invite us over for dinner.
segments.cn: 你邀请我们来吃晚餐真是太好了。

segments.en: I don't want to go over to his place for dinner.
Why on earth did you accept?
It'll be nice to get to know him.
Besides, he's new to the neighborhood, and it'll be rude to decline his invitation.
segments.cn: 而且，他是新搬来的，拒绝他的邀请会很失礼。

segments.en: You always wrote me into things like this.
segments.cn: 你总是让我参与这种事情。

segments.en: How did I get myself into this?
segments.cn: 我怎么会陷入这种境地？

segments.en: We want to know what you think happens next.
segments.cn: 我们想知道你认为接下来会发生什么。

segments.en: What happens in this dialogue next?
segments.cn: 这个对话接下来会发生什么？

segments.en: So we want you to send us your idea of what happens next, and we're going to choose the best one.
segments.cn: 所以我们希望你能告诉我们你认为接下来会发生什么，我们会选择最好的一个。

segments.en: Marco and I will choose the best continuation of the story, and we'll use that in part three of The New Guy in Town.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我会选择故事的最佳续集，我们会在《镇上的新家伙》第三部分中使用它。

segments.en: So you can give it any direction you want.
segments.cn: 所以你可以给它任何方向。

segments.en: And, of course, we'll publish the name of the author with the lesson.
segments.cn: 当然，我们会在课程中公布作者的名字。

segments.en: I'm really anxious to see what ideas come up and how we can end this dialogue.
segments.cn: 我真的很期待看到会出现什么想法，以及我们如何结束这个对话。

segments.en: I know we've got a lot of really creative users out there, so I'm really looking forward to this.
segments.cn: 我知道我们有很多非常有创意的用户，所以我真的很期待这个。

segments.en: So be sure to send us your ideas, either a private message or you can post it on the comments section of this lesson.
segments.cn: 所以一定要把你的想法发给我们，可以发私信或者在这个课程的评论区发布。

segments.en: And any other questions or doubts, go to EnglishPod.com and you can leave them there.
segments.cn: 还有其他问题或疑问，请访问 EnglishPod.com，你可以在那里留言。

segments.en: Marco and I are always happy to answer your questions.
segments.cn: 马尔科和我总是乐意回答你的问题。
